review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Tight - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I owned XXL Castelli bib tights from several years ago, so I ordered the same size in the Free Aero tights.  These things were like knickers on me.  Disappointing because I really liked my older Castellis.  They must have changed their sizing chart or cut. 
Like the previous reviewer, bottom of the legs was loose (but not too bad).  Material and quality seemed fine.  As usual, Competitive Cyclist customer service was awesome and helped me find another brand.
review.name: Runs super small

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Tight - Men's
review.reviewBody: awful, disappointing fit.  straps too short, too tight, limited stretch.  lower leg material below the knee was loose fitting.  several different panels/materials seemed together - just odd looking and odd fit.  the fit from above knee to waist was good but the rest was a miss.  6' tall, 165lbs.  normally wear large in Castelli, bought large.  didn't wear outside, can't comment on warmth or water repel claims.
review.name: Free Aero RC Bib Tight

name: Free Aero RC Bib Tight - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet on a whim. I made a quick trip to Southern Utah and forgot my helmet. I ran into a local climbing shop the morning of my adventure, tried on every helmet they had and this one was the obvious choice. It's the most comfortable and secure feeling helmet I've worn in 10+ years of climbing. My trusty helmet at home will now be a backup for friends, because I can't NOT wear this one after wearing it once. The chin buckle is simple, it feels weightless on, and the purple color is so cute. I'd highly recommend.
review.name: the best lid for your dome.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable,light and does not heat up your head. I just used it to hike Middle Teton, the last part ot the trail and thankfully no falling rocks kicked by other hikers.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: It's good. Seemingly standard solid light well fitting basic helmet. Nothing super fancy, just kind of a go to "it works" helmet. The fit adjust works well. I had to move the shin strap join passthroughs quite a bit forward to make them fit over my ears well, but now they are great.
review.name: Simple, light, clean, fits

review.reviewBody: Comfortable with Great Fit across broad range of head sizes. Perfect for everything from outdoor single pitch to alpine.
Good lightweight helmet. So far used it on an April attempt of Mt Baker, and it worked well with a balaclava and goggles in whiteout conditions.
review.name: Good helmet

review.reviewBody: More plastic than I would like. Definitely don't love having it on but provides safety nonetheless.
review.name: Kinda clunky

review.reviewBody: Great for a beginner! This helmet has protected me from falling rocks while climbing while feeling so comfortable. I usually have issues with adjusting helmets to fit my head properly, and I love how this one is so easy to adjust. Better yet, it didn't cost much too.
review.name: Can't beat the price!!

review.reviewBody: Purchased this climbing helmet for my two daughters to share. Easy adjustment, universal fit, no complaints.
Super comfy, fits great, very light. Used outside, for both ice and regular climbing.

One of the most basic helmets. Does what it is supposed to, just does not last long. Have not had it for a year, and the adjustor in back is broken already. The foam padding started coming out shortly after using it. I would still recommend as a beginner helmet, just as a placeholder until another helmet is acquired.
review.name: Starter helmet

name: Skywalker 3.0 Climbing Helmet

review.reviewBody: got to tell you I purchased a pair of speed goats and found the quality lacking. the insoles slip up on one shoe every time I wear them. the go down on the other shoe sometimes. the vibram sole is coming off on one. I've only worn them about a dozen times for casual wear. too bad, otherwise they seem nice
review.name: need better quality control

review.reviewBody: I've always swore by the speedboat line. Purchased may pairs of the 4's and 5's in wide. The 6 feels completely different and not in a good way. Stiff and uncomfortable compared to previous models. Why change something that was so perfect? Now, I'm not sure where to go. I see 5's are still available but not in wide. I guess I have to start over on my search for my perfect trail shoe. :-(
review.name: A Step Backwards

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Hoka's (Hoka Arahi 6 was my first pair) and I was very disappointed when after hiking only 5.5 miles on a moderate trail the toe of the sole was peeling off... I've run nearly 500 miles the my Hoka Arahi 6's with no issues and I've run hundreds of miles in other shoes and have never had this issue. I don't drag my toe at all and this trail wasn't even that challenging or technical yet the Speedgoat 6's failed after only 5.5 miles!! This was very disappointing especially from a brand with the reputation of Hoka. It's worth noting that I think Hoka is a great brand and shoe manufacturer I love my Arahi 6's however the speedgoat 6 is just not it hopefully this changes!
review.name: Very Disappointing

review.reviewBody: You guys fixed the heel flare but the lockdown still leaves something to be desired. Midsole is nice and responsive but not sure it is soft enough for distances over 50 miles
review.name: Upgrade from the 5 but definitely not the GOAT anymore

review.reviewBody: Best version yet. Don't understand all the complaints. If you want mush for midsole, buy the Mafate Speed 4 or Zoom X Nikes. If you're a serious trail runner or mountaineer, and want a precise, nimble fit with excellent lockdown and traction, these are for you. More responsive than prior models and the platform is narrower. Toe box more forgiving. I had switched to Altras for 2 years because I got sick of Hokas narrow toe boxes but Altras just aint the same and the tox box of these is excellent. If you find these too firm, you're likely not running on terrain that justifies buying these because if you did, you'd find these plenty cush or you have some dainty, sensitive feet. These are best suited for any distance on rough, technical terrain, not buffed out flats. Switching back to Hokas for good!
review.name: The G.O.A.T of the goats!

review.reviewBody: I run 10 miles a day everyday except the days I run longer runs. I loved the speedgoat 5's. I hit reorder my last order and got the speedgoat 6's. (Which was NOT my last order) they were great at first, but after the first week of using them they now dig into my ankles (try running 25 miles with your shoe digging into your ankle, very unpleasant.) I tried adjusting the laces and doubling socks, nope. So sad, I really love the Speedgoat style, especially the rubber soles. The other styles have that stupid foam that wears down super quick. Needless to say, I am very disappointed.
review.name: They dig into my ankles

review.reviewBody: I bet I've had 10 pairs of Speedgoats. They were fantastic! I just ordered and returned the Speedgoat 6. They were huge and the construction was very poor. They should concertate on quality not how many crazy colors and patterns they can get on one shoe.
review.name: SAD SPEEDGOAT CUSTOMER

review.reviewBody: I purchased my pair of SpeedGoat 6's at my local running shop, they fit ok in the shop and generally they do fit my heel to ball well, the toe box feels tighter than it used to though. overall I think it has potential to be a good shoe but O.M.G it is stiff, I do not know what it is but I feel like I'm stepping on a board with a thin layer of padding while using these. Mileage doesn't help either, they seem to continue to be stiff after putting down miles. I'll probably go back to my other shoes and get a different pair of trail runners down the line, which really sucks because I was excited about these.
review.name: Very stiff compared to previous versions

review.reviewBody: Wore the soles off my speedgoat 5's so it was time to replace them. Tried the 6's and they feel very similar to the 5's which is exactly what I wanted
review.name: Love at first step

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like the sixes but had to take them back. I've been a big Speedgoat fan and usually love the next iteration. I purchased these from my local running shoe store and ran four miles in them. Immediately after my run, my feet were sore. I put my Fives on and felt a big difference. I felt the sixes were more structured than the fives and narrower in the toe box. I found it hard for my foot to settle into the shoe's footbed. The fives feel softer. I am still sticking with Speedgoats for my fall races; I am just buying another pair of fives. Maybe the sevens will work.
review.name: Staying With the Fives

name: Speedgoat 6 Wide Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Patagonia Capilene Thermal Weight Bottoms - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Capilene Thermal Weight Bottoms - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Capilene Thermal Weight Bottoms - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Was taking a trip to Ecuador to climb some Andean peaks, including Chimborazo, the closest you can get to the sun on Earth. I tried half a dozen different baselayer before settling on these. These were the warmest of all the baselayers I had tried. But we're really lacking in durability.

Pros:
Warm
Comfortable
Blue color is cool

Cons:
-Durability. I have only worn them once, for about ten hours, and they are already showing more wear and tear than other baselayers I have had for a decade or more. No other baselayer has shown this much wear and tear, even when worn with the same shells. Doesn't bode well for long term lifespan.
-Loose ankles**. This is totally a preference thing. There are two groups or opinions here. One group of people like loose ankles, and they pull the ankles up to their calves to keep them out of their ski boots or mountaineering boots, which causes bunching of fabric up around the calf. The other group of people likes snug tight fitting ankles that go inside the boot(s). Being snug prevents folds, wrinkles, and pressure points. I am in the latter group. So while SOME people may appreciate the loose floppy ankles with tons of extra fabric, I don't. I'd definitely want them more snug. Think about which group you belong to.

All things considered, would not buy again, not even at half price. Maybe if I could get them at 70% off or more, but even at 50% off, they're not worth it.

I have a 31" waist and inseam, and the small fit well (except the big baggy  ankles...)
review.name: Warm, with pros and cons

name: Capilene Thermal Weight Bottoms - Men's

review.reviewBody: I think the mosquito net is great overall and it does the job with providing an easy way to put a mosquito net up around your hammock. And the idea of the magnet closure is awesome however the magnets need to be a bit stronger to actually snap shut and stay shut. I've tried a few different ways to adjust this but I've found any major movement of you hammock and the magnets release. And it's not easy to reclose the netting without a bit of shifting around.
review.name: Great idea lacking execution

Pros: not a complicated setup/takedown (once you figure it out), lots of adjustability, spacious, has small accessory pocket that hangs from center, quality construction-seems durable

Cons: no directions included and picture on package is hard to follow, the door is too small and a little awkward (I am 5'10", 165lbs), if you drop anything from the hammock it will open the magnetic door at the bottom
review.name: Not a bad option, quality product, will keep the bugs out.

review.reviewBody: The net was far more pack-able than I expected, and didn't take up much room in my bag. Some friends and I were doing a late August hike up Eagle Peak in YNP. There was just enough extra room underneath my hammock to put a small bag with my phone, bear spray and luci lamp. Didn't have any mosquitoes or horse flies find their way through. I can't wait to use it thru hiking this coming summer!
review.name: Excellent on a buggy summit hike

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased this jersey in a large and had to send it back for a medium, which happens to me a lot in shirts.  I'm 6'2" and 176 and I guess I'm sort of in between sizes on shirts/jerseys, but the medium fit great!   The return process was easy and Backcountry ships quick.   What I really like is that it's super lightweight and breathable, which is great for summer riding in Texas.  I'm so happy with it, I'm ordering another one in a different color.  It's hard to pass up when I know it's going to fit and it's not crazy expensive.
review.name: My favorite jersey

review.reviewBody:
I've owned several Skyline products over the years and all of them have been great. This jersey is lightweight, breathable, and super comfortable. The stretch material means the jersey moves with you rather than holding you back.

If you're looking for a comfortable jersey that fits well at a reasonable price look no further.
review.name: Comfortable and Breathable

review.reviewBody: Tearing apart after 1 ride. Worn a hour tops with hydration pack and is coming apart under the arms. Jersey is hot garbage. Dont buy, waste of money
review.name: Don't buy

name: Skyline Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

description: Buy the Salomon Prolink Access Skate Binding - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Prolink Access Skate Binding - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Prolink Access Skate Binding - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've used these on light off-trail skis (Fischer Traverse 78s) for a couple of winters. They work well and are durable.  I like using skate bindings on these skis because they make control of the ski tail easier when herringboning or side-stepping uphill (the stiffer toe bumper seems to snap the tail into the proper/desired position).
review.name: Good Bindings

review.reviewBody: My SNS Pilot boot was wrecked (don’t ask) and I discovered there was no replacing it. So had to get NNN compatible bindings for new boots. The ski shop said I would need new skis too but they were wrong. Was able to replace the bindings myself with these. Exact same hole pattern. Needed a #3 PoziDriv screwdriver. Hopefully will get a few more seasons of use from skis.
review.name: Replaced SNS bindings

review.reviewBody: These bindings seemed to work great for my partner, but on my first skate adventure one of the plastic parts broke while I was herringboning uphill. I didn't land hard on it, crash, or anything, but the heel piece snapped in half when I put my foot down. I'm 6'3", 195 lbs, so it seems like these bindings should've held up.
review.name: Good binding, not durable
comment: Hi, we're sorry to hear about the issue you encountered during your skate adventure. At Salomon, we strive to provide high-quality products that meet the needs of our customers. Please know that we will investigate this matter further to understand what may have caused the plastic part to break. Your feedback helps us improve our products and ensure the satisfaction of our customers.

review.reviewBody: Boutht it last month from Russia, and on my 2nd time out the spings on the bindings got disengaged from the holding holes. It happened when I dropped a ski while unloading from a car.  The shock somehow made the springs get off the place. Now way to put it back, unless in the factory, it seems.
review.name: Good bindings for skate skis for a price
comment:
Thank you for letting us know, we're really sorry that the binding is no longer functional!

It's a really unfortunate situation, however sadly our warranties are limited, and impact damage is not covered. Consequentially we would be unable to off you a warranty on these.

Please feel free to reach out to the Salomon representatives in your area, they may know of somewhere you could get these repaired, or be able to offer you further advice on this.

For Russia, our contact details are below: 

RUSSIA
ZAO “AMER SPORTS”
Tel: +7 495 6412646

name: Prolink Access Skate Binding - 2025

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loving the fit of this top. Comfy and looks great!
review.name: Nice top

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] love the cut of this bikini top and really appreciate how secure it is while swimming in the ocean. i also like that there is not a clasp to deal with. and the zinnia name is what made me hit the purchase button.
review.name: love the cut of this

review.reviewBody: Love the color and style of this top! I’m an average 65 yr old who refuses to become frumpy! This top makes me feel good and not too “young .” Go for it!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: It’s so hard to find a bikini that’s flattering but also doesn’t feel like your girls are going to fall out. I sized up to a medium and since there are adjustable straps, my short upper body was no issue since there are adjustable straps. Thanks so much Carve for designing a top that a small person with a D or DD can wear!
review.name: Awesome for a 34D or 32DD

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this ! I wear it as a swimsuit top and an active bra for activities near the water or if I know I’m going to sweat a lot!! Great support. Very comfortable. I wear without the cups. I own it in several colors.
review.name: Great bra top

review.reviewBody: Bought to match the Bali shorts, so cute on! I have a small chest 34B and got the small. It’s padded so gives me a little shape. It’s a pull on and love that there’s no uncomfortable hook or knot in the back! Just soft and comfy!
review.name: Very comfortable and cute!

review.reviewBody:
Love the fabric and style. Adjustable straps are key. I bought this to replace the Stinson top I bought a few years ago (it stretched out).

I'm a 34A bra size and this fits well. I like swimsuits I can be active in with my 3 kids and family.
review.name: Great quality swim top with adjustable straps

review.reviewBody: The bikini top fits beautifully with the right amount of coverage. The design is flattering, and the material looks and feels great. Looking forward to trying it out in the water!
review.name: Super cute and comfortable swim top

review.reviewBody: Love the style, this is my second one just a different color. Really comfy and environmentally friendly
review.name: Love my suit top

review.reviewBody: Great for this small busted woman! Very flattering and comfortable.
review.name: Functional & Cute

review.itemreviewed: Ovik Knit Roller Neck Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this sweater as a Christmas present. It is really beautiful and looks as on the pictures. However it is not soft at all. The kind of wool it is made from would be more suitable for making coats: extremely coarse and scratchy against the skin. Even with a cotton base underneath I cannot wear this pullover. I have other 100% wool garments at home and I have no problem wearing those.
review.name: Bevare, really scratchy wool

review.itemreviewed: Ovik Knit Roller Neck Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: This was my first Fjallraven clothing purchase and I can't wait to buy more from the brand.  This sweater is soft, warm and has a nice structure (vs. slouchy).  I've worn it numerous times over the past couple of months and it has not gotten baggy in the arms or pilled.  The colors are even prettier in person.  I tried to buy a matching "green" Fjallraven hat but they don't carry a green that matches this sweater.  The sweater is true to size and is fitted and not blousy.  Happily obsessed!
review.name: Gorgeous and soft

name: Ovik Knit Roller Neck Sweater - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They're fabulous! Great fit, great looking, and wonderfully comfortable!
review.name: Just Plain Great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got these and love them! They stay up nicely, and you can never go wrong with wool socks. They're expensive but worth it. I haven't had them long enough to know how long they'll last but they seem well constructed - similar to the smartwool I usually buy (which last me many years). Wool socks help prevent smells too - so you're warm & not stinky - win win.
review.name: Wool for the win!

review.reviewBody: My husband spends most of the day standing on concrete. Even with very nice work boots and insoles, his feet are still tired and sore. He's spent literal decades looking for socks, and then we found these. He LOVES them. Some pairs are four years old, have been worn every week or two for all four years, and still look and feel great. I am on a teacher's salary but when I see these on sale, I buy them. We have some lightweight ones for summer and some medium weight ones for fall and winter. If your know someone who is on their feet a lot (nurse, mechanic, teacher) these are THE socks to give them. I cannot recommend them highly enough. My dad is a farmer and guess what he's been getting for birthdays, Father's Day, Christmas, etc. the last few years? Well, he discovered these socks from my husband and is now filling his own sock drawer with them!
review.name: Literally all my husband's socks are being replaced by these

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They've kept my feet more dry than any socks I've ever had, and have a great fit compared to other brands. My toes have freedom to spread and the socks stay comfortably where they should.
review.name: Best socks I've ever owned

name: Hike+ Medium Crew Sock

review.reviewBody: Having experimented with many packs, I've never come across one that is so well thought out and well-made. This pack excels at rucking, which is what my company, Ruck Evolution uses the Bridger 45 for. We load packs with between 10 and 20 percent of a person's body weight and go for group and team-building hikes. The comfort and fit is exceptional.
review.name: What an Amazing Pack

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago because I got back into rucking. I needed something with some good support on both shoulders and hips. I use it for a multitude of other things as well. I served in the US army and thought tha standard issue rucks where good, but boy was i wrong. I love this pack and have rucked with 45lbs in it and could hardly feel the weight. I will forever use MR.
review.name: First MR bag

review.reviewBody:
I’ve taken this pack on multiple trips into the eastern sierras. One trip up Mt. Whitney with many more into the surrounding area. On my most recent trip hiked into the Cottenwood Lake area up New Army pass, within the first half mile one of the teeth on the waist belt buckle snapped. I figured this would render the pack useless for heavy loads, I was carrying roughly 45 pounds, but I was wrong the belt was actually still able to buckle and function. This leads to the 1 star review for poor quality of the buckle. My next complaint is the design for the bottom side compression straps. They’ve been designed it to go through the cup holder mounted on the side and with a Nalgene sized bottle can make it difficult to compress.  
That being said, everything else about the pack is stellar. One feature I find incredibly helpful is the shoulder strips, they have taken out the padding in favor of large surface area to distribute the weight. What this means for you is less heat build up under your straps and more airflow to reduce sweat. It also distributes weight exceptionally well. Weight distribution is nearly perfect. They’ve added a detachable top pouch which allows you to leave your pack at camp in favor of a light fanny/sling to carry necessities. The final feature I like are the nicely sized pockets on the shoulder straps. These are large enough to fit an iPhone, small 500ml silicone bladder or what ever you need readily accessible.
review.name: Great 1-3 day pack with cheap buckles

review.reviewBody: I got my mystery ranch pack about a month ago to replace a very old backpack that I had. I was first exposed to mystery Ranch on the fire service where we used the wild line pack, and the medic pack on wildland fire incident, the comfort and awesome features of this pack are second to none. I would highly recommend this For any type of hiking or backpacking application
review.name: Awesome fit and comfort

review.reviewBody:
I've been using the Bridger 45 for several months now, and it has proven to be an excellent choice for bridging the gap between 30-35L daypacks and larger 60-70L backpacks. As a Search and Rescue (SAR) team member, the Bridger serves me well as a 24-hour backpack, replacing my old Rush when I need more volume or want to ease the strain on my back. I've taken it on road trips, used it on long hikes in cold weather to carry some extra stuff or to unload some gear from my family members. In summary, I absolutely love this backpack, especially for its incredibly comfortable harness, amount of space and features. 

Pros:
    - The harness is amazing. It’s very comfortable. 25 lbs load is almost unnoticeable, my back and shoulders are not tired even after 8 hours of SAR operational day (I’m in a good shape though). 35-40 lbs load also feels good as the weight is perfectly spread across hips and back. The backpack sits well on your back no matter how much you move. You can climb on a hill, crawl through the mezzanine or run, and the backpack stays perfectly in place. 
    - MR Quality is outstanding, as with other backpacks. I have no concerns in any piece of the backpack - each zipper, each buckle looks and feels like you can rely on it. I’m pretty sure the backpack will last even with my heavy usage and constant abuse - spending hours under the rain, crawling in the mud, dragging over the rocks and etc.
     - The Bridger maintains its comfort and stability, whether underfilled or overloaded.
     - Numerous features and attachment points accommodate accessories and tools, allowing for external carry and efficient weight distribution.
     - The 3-zipper opening system is super convenient, making it easy to find items without rummaging through everything.
 
Cons: 
     - Chest bottle pockets aren't ideal for my usage. I use hydration pack (I assume that's a case for most of potential Bridger buyers) and would prefer regular pockets or the option to detach them and use MOLLE pouches instead.
     - Waist belt pockets are relatively small. I think it is probably not a problem for most of the users, but I personally would prefer just MOLLE straps like on Terraform so I could attach my own pouches. 
      - Comparing to tactical backpacks, it has lack of organizing features. Again, you probably don’t need it for hiking, but I’m trying to keep my SAR stuff organized in a way that allows me to find anything in complete darkness using only one hand. I’m missing some small pockets. I use Zoid Bag, but there is an attachment point for only one small size.
       - The chest straps, along with bottle pockets, make it challenging to use additional chest harnesses common in SAR teams.

Ideas for Improvement:

- Attachment points for medium-sized Zoid Bags inside the backpack along its length.
- A sunshades pocket with a bit of protective padding could be a valuable addition.
- Loops or keychain hooks inside the waist pockets would be useful.
- The option to remove the bottle pockets on the chest harness.

Overall, the Bridger 45 is an impressive backpack. It's spacious, feature-rich, well-built, and boasts an outstanding harness for comfortable long-distance wear. While I've identified some cons, they are specific to my SAR use, and the only debatable feature is the chest water bottle sacks
review.name: Almost perfect midsize backpack

review.reviewBody:
having two zippers on the front is genius.  
I also enjoy the hydration storage.  Nice fit. Finally, the two pockets in the front straps is amazing and leaves plenty of room for my sat phone and snacks.  I’d like to recommend moving the hip strap pockets more forward for easy access.
review.name: Love the access to contents.

review.reviewBody: I got this pack to use as an overnight (1-2days) camping/backpacking pack. This pack has its limitations. Alot smaller than expected. Great for summer backpacking trips. I don’t recommend this pack for rugged terrain like military or for hunters. General use only.
review.name: Very Minimalistic

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a Go Bag for 0-72 hour use, and it has proven to fit everything I needed, and more. All I need to do yet is to order and use the Zoid Bags, in order to sequester specific items such as med kits, individual emergency/maintenance meds, lighting, fire, food, toiletries, and etc. The Bottom Line is that I have researched and bought several other bags, and this has prove to be perfect for my needs, which was to be low-profile and holds all my needs, without being too large and screaming, "I have good stuff in here!!!" The top of the bag will also hold an additional bag for quick access, but there aren't a lot of other attachment points on the exterior for things like an IFAK, and that would be nice to have...perhaps those attachment points might be added to improve the bag a bit. Otherwise, this bag exceeded my personal standards, especially fit, and I am a 40-year Army Special Forces veteran, so I have some wide experience in this arena. Well done, Mystery Ranch. v/r, D.S. COL, US Army Special Forces
review.name: Excellent Go Bag pack

review.reviewBody: I have had the chance to use my new pack on 5 days of hiking.  I was looking for a versatile pack that was comfortable as well as durable.  My first hike was 12 miles through Glacier Park. I overloaded the pack on purpose to test it.  I was curious if the light waist belt would be comfortable.  It did not disappoint.  No wear points on the hips.  The double breast straps are adjustable or removable.  I actually ended up liking the two adjustable straps.  Pockets on shoulder straps were handy for bear spray or other items.  Pockets on waist belt worked better for smaller items than my cell phone, My phone fit, but it was stretch.  The Pocket on the back of the pack was great for when I pulled off rain gear.  Didn’t have to put wet gear in the pack.  Second test was a couple of 10 mile hikes on the Continental Divide Trail on Montana and Idaho border.  Pack contents stayed dry in the rain without fly, and again wore well.  This pack has room to pack extra layers, shelter, medical, water, and food.  You can overload it for short hikes if you are not careful.  This is my first Mystery Ranch pack. After use, I really did not find negative thoughts on the pack, Closest I could get is hydration bladder does not hang, it has a pocket.  Seemed to work fine.  I have had firefighter team members that rave about the quality of the Mystery Ranch products.  I would agree, I don’t think you will be disappointed with purchase.
review.name: Great Pack

review.reviewBody: This pack has blown away my expectations and set a new standard! To say the least the bar is set extremely high. However I hope this bag last me for a very long time. Straight out of the box it fit perfectly ( Size L, 6’0 210lbs). I was amazed at this in itself. I have tried on numerous packs in my quest to find the one that fit just right. It always seems like I needed to make an adjustment here or there and they never felt great… I was settling. Then!! I ordered a MR In and Out 22 L pack for quick summits and it over preformed. What’s big deal in such a small pack! WOW. Everything you need and nothing you don’t. So, I figured why not stick with MR and get the Bridger 45? That’s exactly what I did. It’s holds everything I need for my backpacking trips. This bag is seamless and very easy to use. It even boast a separate quick access compartment for your sleeping bag! I love this feature. This is my experience and I hope everyone else has one similar. Have fun out there.
review.name: MAKE THIS YOUR NEXT PACK!

name: Bridger 45L Backpack

The additional tools built into the handle make it totally worth it when you carry the MSR stove system. I've never once needed to use it, but hike comfortably knowing it's there if I ever do!

review.reviewBody: I love this spoon. This is a great size spoon and handles for camping. I like it so much though I use it every other day or more at work. I also use it to eat soup because it is a nicer shape than my normal flatware. I really like how rigid the spoon is for the weight. This is excellent. I only wish they also made a spork, and fork to round out my home flatware. I also really like how this spoon will service my stove if I ever need it to.
review.name: The best flatware (spoon) anywhere

review.reviewBody: Great MRE length Titanium Tool Spoon- but good for more than MRE's- such as mixing / stirring the pot while coking, etc.

review.reviewBody: Just came off 8 days in the Sawtooth using these. The length is great for backpackers pantry or mountain house meals. Also double using it to take the lid off our pot when it's boiling water.

review.reviewBody: Perfect for Mountain House meals. Probably won't ever use the tool function but who knows.
review.name: Perfect for Mountain House meals

review.reviewBody: Really great for the premade just-add-hot-water backpacking meals. Regular spoons can't easily reach the bottom of the pouch.
review.name: Finally, a long spoon!

review.itemreviewed: Thermal Merino Drape Neck Hoodie - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought the Chalk Violet Heather and Black/Charcoal Heather and they arrived today. I already know I will live in them at least 3 seasons a year, but I wanted to give some sizing notes. I've bought Smartwool clothing for 15+ years and my instinct was to order my original size (XL), but I decided on L because their tops have been running larger in recent years. It was the right call. The black/charcoal fits me perfectly, close-fitting without being tight. Oddly, the purple one is slightly larger than the black/charcoal (particularly under the arms) even though they're the same size. It's not enough of an issue to return it but I wish there was some quality control in this world.
review.name: I will live in these

review.reviewBody: My daughter wears a size 7 so based on the size chart, I ordered her a 36 in these shoes. They arrived and looked like they would fit a small toddler only. I checked the chart again and moved her up to a 37.5.  When they arrived, the box clearly has the US size equivalent on the box. According to the box, they were a 6.5 in US sizes.  They were STILL too small.  I'm sending those back now and went to get a 3rd pair.  I checked the chart again and it does seem to be updated and more accurate now.  For her size 7 shoe I am now going to order a 39 and see if that works. Besides the size, these look great.
review.name: SMALL, size chart may have been adjusted

review.reviewBody: I can’t speak to the performance of these shoes because they run so ridiculously small I had to return them. I am a W 8.5 and based on the size chart ordered a 40.5, which was the HIGH end of the suggested range for my size. I couldn’t even straighten my toes out when I tried them on. Super disappointed as I used my 20% off promotion and now have to pay for return shipping :(
review.name: Runs extremely small

name: Reflex V Climbing Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: Guide Vest
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Guide Vest online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Enjoying the vest capacity. Wore out my G4 old style jacket. My new G4 jacket lacks the storage of old jacket. Wearing vest over jacket for added capacity needed on stream. Lots of pockets and zipper compartments that I have already comited a layout that works well for me.
review.name: Well laid out

review.reviewBody: I chose the Guide Vest Steel xxl. After transferring all of my stuff from my cheaper vest, I still have "Gobs" of room. My movement is not hindered in anyway wearing the Simms. Phenomenal! Def the right choice.
review.name: I'm Glad

review.reviewBody: So far, so good! We’ll see how it stands up. Seems well made

Very comfortable. Good quality. 
Many useful pockets for a productive fishing adventure.
review.name: What I was expecting

review.reviewBody: Had this vest for a few years now and love it! Tons of room for plenty of tackle. I wade fish for smallmouth in wv and walk a long way to fish. This vest provides plenty of storage for everything I may need when I'm a long trek away from anywhere. Have no complaints.

I’ve had several of these over the last few decades, and they just keep getting better. First, their design is intuitive. I end up putting the same things in the same pockets because I know what’s where with my eyes closed. The left side of mine is set up for dry flies and the materials for keeping floating high. The right side is dedicated to nymphs, split shot and various strike indicators. Works very well for me.
review.name: Keeps getting better

review.reviewBody:
I was so reluctant to abandon my old Simms Guide Vest. We’d been together a long time and on a lot of rivers and we have a history together. But it finally gave out or perhaps rotted out because as I said, we’d been together a long time and like that old joke about being put away wet, it was, many times.

I like my new vest because it’s almost a carbon copy of Old Faithful. The pocket flaps might be larger and the velcro even stickier, but other than
that very similar so I know that with time it too will earn my love and admiration.

My one gripe about the vest is the two little whatever sleeves on either side of the bottom/front of the vest. They don’t fit what they should fit….floatant, dry shake, weed, whatever. Their taper makes them ok for almost nothing except maybe an eyeglass cloth or snipped debris from tippets.

The End
review.name: A New Old Friend

review.reviewBody: I really like the guide vest. I wore a vest made for me by by wife 40 years ago until the zippers failed on 2 big pockets. There’s only one vest that I wanted to replace hers, and I’m glad I bought it. It’s been used in Idaho, Montana, California, and Colorado in the couple of months since I got it. Great vest.
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody:
Pros
- Lots of storage space.
- Lightweight.

Cons
- No waterbottle holder.
- Gear falls out of some pockets easily. I lost some stuff on the river as a result.
review.name: Simms Vest

review.reviewBody: Vest is great, pockets are sized well.  Like it a lot.
review.name: great vest

name: Guide Vest

review.reviewBody: Great pants but NO POCKETS except for one in the back is absolutely ridiculous. In what world are we living in where pants don’t come with front pockets. Super disappointing. No advertisement about this or photos showing that there is none. Would of reconsidered if I knew this
review.name: NO FRONT POCKETS

review.reviewBody: Waterproof but not too stiff or bulky. They roll up nice and light and I never have to think about throwing them in my pack “just in case” it rains. Very good goretex but the durability is a bit questionable. I tend to rip them on sticks and branches. But I suppose that is the trade off on getting something lightweight and comfortable.  I’m on my third pair of these in five years but I will be buying another one once I’ve worn these ones out.
review.name: I keep buying these… on my third pair now

review.reviewBody: I wore these rain pants on a 4 day hunting trip in November.  It rained 3 out of the 4 days.  These pants kept me dry the whole time.  I love the packability with being able to stuff them into the back pocket.  When stuffed, these pants are roughly the size of a 32 oz Nalgene water bottle.  With this feature, I end up carrying these pants in my day pack for surprise weather.  The one thing I wish is that there was a little more stretch for stepping over logs while hiking through the woods.
review.name: Great Light Weight Rain Pants

review.reviewBody: I bought the pants and jacket about a year or two ago. I've used them lightly here and there. Last night, I was at the Packers/Lions game in Green Bay where it rained the entire day... tailgating, during the game, after the game... about 6 hours of a steady rain.  This suit was easy to move in, the vents allowed it to breathe, and most importantly I was bone dry... cannot recommend these enough.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: The pants look and feel the right size. Im 210, 6'3" and originally ordered the reg length. These however were way to long. I sent them back and re ordered the xl short size which fit alot better. The quality of the pants is good however Ive yet to use them. Can update when i take them hiking this summer.
review.name: Good look and Light, but the size is off

review.reviewBody: Used these recently for a 8 day canoe trip in the Bowron Lakes in Canada. Rained every day but stayed perfectly dry and comfortable because of these pants. Fit was perfect for activities around camp.
review.name: Great rain pant

review.reviewBody: Very happy with my decision to purchase the Foray Gore-Tex rain pants. They are lightweight, packable, and keep you dry. I am 5'11" tall with a 31" inseam, and the M short fits me well. Zippered legs and ankle elastic are great features.
review.name: Great rain pants!

review.reviewBody: Overall a very good product. Amazing for rainy weather and walking through tall wet grass. 2 things I wish were different: 1 - I wish the elastic cuffs on ankles were tighter (not a big deal) 2 - I wish there were pocket zippers so i could access my pockets on my pants inside
review.name: Goretex Foray Pants Review

review.reviewBody: Ordered a short version and was still around 32in inseam. I could only imagine how long the regular version is, based on other reviews. I can confirm what others are stating in terms of length. Otherwise, pants work well in the rain!
review.name: Insanely long inseam

name: Foray Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: It works spins up nice and they last. When it starts to creak, remove it clean it up and keep peddling.
review.name: Shimano bottom bracket

review.reviewBody: I installed a new SM-BBR60 bottom bracket on my Salsa Vaya commuter.  I road it until it had just a bit of play in it.  I got 12,728 miles out of it.  I'm 6'2, 200lbs and I ride 70% road and 30% gravel on my commute.  I paid $25.59 for it.  Needless to say, I installed another new SM-BBR60 today.  I doubt there's a better value out there!
review.name: Shimano Ultegra BB:  SM-BBR60

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bottom bracket to refurbish a bike as a gift to my little sister. Great price. Solid performance. I've been riding on a Shimano BB for a solid minute and trust it so much to put my lil sis on it.

The new rig has allowed her to enjoy cycling so much more.

The bracket does the business and she feels more secure and connected while she's on it.

Standard installation and no surprises.
review.name: Refurb Success

review.reviewBody: Fit well and  is smooth.  Had to re-face my BB to remove OEM paint job and now everything is smooth and perfectly aligned.
review.name: Good BB

review.reviewBody:
This was the best bb upgrade, smooth and quite.. no creaking. Easy to install... I must have about 3000 miles on it with no issues.

Would definitely recommend
review.name: The best $20 upgrade, money well spent!

name: Ultegra SM-BBR60 Bottom Bracket

review.reviewBody: The first time out with my new Yeti the chain broke.  Over 30 years of riding and I have never broke a chain.  Anyway, the guys at Competitive Cyclist took care of me by sending master links and chain tool expeditiously so I did not miss any riding.  Ten minutes to fix and I have had several great rides this last week.  I know defective chains happen and crap happens but it is what happens when an issue comes up that makes you buy and keep buying from a vendor.  CC is a great company full of people who love to bike and understand you/me.  Thanks for a great overall buying experience from the Yeti bike to the gear to the tools needed to keep me on the trail.
review.name: Saved the day

name: Chain Drive - Chain Breaker Tool

description: Buy the Stoic Single Cloud Camp Bed online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Single Cloud Camp Bed
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stoic Single Cloud Camp Bed online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these for my wife and I to try as a reasonably priced upgrade to our car camping gear. I've been sleeping on nearly 20 yr-old ThermaRest base camp pads for a comparison, but I was very pleased with the Stoic Cloud Camp Bed. It was very comfortable, and I found myself waking up less and sleeping better. I'm only 5 nights in, so it's too soon to comment on longevity or durability, but the initial quality seems good, and the comfort is great.
review.name: Best camp sleep yet!

review.reviewBody: Used this a handful of times now. It is totally comparable in comfort to the Nemo and exped versions for 1/3 of the price. Seems decently durable as well. It is quite large, and I wish they made a 6ft version so it would fit in a truck, but it fills the space nicely in my Big Agnes Tigerwall 2. I will also probably get one of those tiny chargeable pumps for it. It self inflates fine with an additional breath or two for additional firmness, but in order to get it back down to a packable size, you kinda need a vacuum. By hand I can pack it down to just about the size of the bag with the straps on, but not quite small enough to fit into the bag. Using a vacuum it can pack down to nearly half the size of the bag which is a pretty significant difference.
review.name: Big, awesome, and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Loved this thing at first, very comfortable. But in a little over a year the valve started leaking around the bottom where it is not fixable. Now I have a giant piece of plastic garbage.
review.name: Gargage

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this bed! I ordered the double cloud camp bed and have put it through the ringer. The only problem was that it is too big (takes up lots of space packing and too big when car camping. Which is why I bough the smaller version. I'd say it is 1/3 or 1/4 the size which is much better for packing and use in car camping. I just wish it came with a washable sleeve to slip it into and i can do without the color (would have preferred the beaver fur color). Its so easy to use you'd easy over think it. Buy it and enjoy the best night of sleep you can get outdoors. Best part is you don't get rocked when you dog moves like you would with an inflatable.
review.name: Two Time Buyer

review.reviewBody: I bought this because I’m a side sleeper most of the time and I also toss and turn all night. This was sooo uncomfortable and then it did not inflate all the way, so I used my flex tail to try to put so more air in it and the flex tail is definitely not made for that type of sleeping pad, because it’s suppose to self inflate. I will try it again on my next camping trip. I going to invest in another portable inflator to see if I get better results.
review.name: Not that comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Ordered the Single Cloud last minute and was very pleased with it. Set-up was very simple (open the valve and make sure it is in a position to "receive" air). Arrived at the campsite late and was in a rush to go to sleep, so I did blow into the valve a bit to speed up the process. The pad was ready in less than 5 minutes, I'm not certain how long it would take if pad is left alone to fill itself.
The pad remained firm through the 3 nights and it did not need any additional adjustments. This was a pleasant surprise, especially compared to my prior experiences. It is comfortable and the size was perfect, I did not roll off of it at any point.
Lastly, rolling it up was pretty easy, flip the valve to allow the air out and roll the pad up to ensure all the air is out (apply pressure as needed). Unroll the pad (it'll be pretty flat at this point w/ all the air out) and roll it up again for a tight roll and to let any remaining air out. Tie the pad w/ the ties that are provided.

Not sure how long this will last (should be a long time if last camping trip is any indication), but I would definitely buy the product again.
review.name: Excellent for Camping

review.reviewBody:
Bed is great 
Needs to come with some instructions on inflating 
Found YouTube video that explains was easy to do  when I knew how
Glad I tried at home
review.name: Cloud Camp Bed

review.reviewBody: I paired this pad with a cot and it was awesome.  Best night's sleep I've had while camping.   Couldn't be happier.
review.name: Very Happy!

review.reviewBody: I bought this on recommendation from Renee Roaming and it is absolutely perfect for sleeping in your car. I didn't even notice the gap between the rows of seats I was laying over. Wider than my backpacking pad so it feels more like a luxury. It comes with straps to hold the roll so you don't even need the bag but I had absolutely no problems getting it back in the bag. I'm 350 lbs and it was so comfortable. The only thing its lacking is instructions on how to inflate but a quick YouTube video helps with that.
review.name: Perfect for car camping

review.reviewBody: An inexperienced 55 year old female camper here. I had absolutely no problem with this camping pad. I removed the valve cover and it started filling up with air all by it's self. ( The little pin wheel side showing ). when it was finished inflating, I tried it out and it was so comfy. To deflate the pad, just open the valve cover again, flip the valve to the solid side, ( it doesn't come out, it just turns). Fold up the pad in sections, using your knees ( body weight) to push the air out. When you get to the top, unroll it, then start rolling it up again, from the bottom, rolling tightly. Then replace the Velcro straps that comes with it. Now it will easily slide back into it's sack, with no struggle at all. I did it on the 1st try. It does not come with instructions but I just gave them to you. You are very welcome. I love this sleeping pad. It's awesome. For side sleepers like me, you won't roll off of it just by turning over. It's wide enough.
review.name: Stoic Single Cloud Camp Bed.

name: Single Cloud Camp Bed

description: Buy the Coleman Now 24-Can Tote Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Now 24-Can Tote Cooler
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Now 24-Can Tote Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: As a traveling baseball mom this bag is amazing and keeps beverages cold for long periods of time in the Texas heat.
review.name: Texas Baseball Mom

review.reviewBody: This bag is great for day trip packing.  The roomy cooler keeps everything ice cold and is water tight.  The well thought design of the expandable pockets are a great use and hold tons of items, from toys, clothes and other necessities. My family will get plenty use out of this product for days by the pool and at the beach.
review.name: Awesome Tote and Cooler All-in-One!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Coleman 24-Can Tote, has been  a lifesaver during my hospital stays and appointments for my son. This tote isn't just for outdoor adventures it's for any adventures an essential companion for keeping essentials cool and accessible on-the-go.
One of the first things that I loved was its spacious capacity. Despite its compact size, I could easily fit everything I needed snacks, drinks, medication, and personal items in tote. This made it incredibly convenient to bring along during my appointments.
The insulation of the Coleman tote is top-notch. Even when I left it in the car for hours during appointments, my items remained refreshingly cool. This was particularly important for storing medications and perishable items, giving me peace of mind knowing they were properly preserved.
I loved all the extra pockets provided convenient storage for smaller items like napkins, tissues, straws and even my phone.
review.name: This is a must have for all adventures.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how convenient this cooler tote is. I can throw in some bottles of chocolate milk and maybe a few yogurt squeeze tubes into the cooler part with an ice pack and then use the "dry storage" on the sides for chips and other snacks that don't need refrigeration. It makes it much easier to take snacks for the kids for afternoons at the park, zoo trips and any other extended outing where snacks are nice to have. Prior to getting this I was using a large tote bag with some minimal insulation. I wasn't comfortable carrying things that needed to stay cold in it which limited the snack variety for trips out. This is also super easy to clean with a wipe clean interior in the cooler part.
review.name: Great for life with kids

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Coleman tote cooler is very nice! It is spacious and insulated on the inside. It also has extra pockets on the outside that can expand for more storage. Love this thing.
review.name: Nice!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this cooler complimentary to try and review. I love it! I have already used it for an outdoorsy day with the family and it held a ton! It is going to be perfect for the summer when we go to the beach. I love that it can be more compact or you can unfold the sides and you have triple the storage space!
review.name: Very spacious!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have found my new favorite cooler! This morning I had a bunch of things to take back to the office after working remotely. I added my lunch to the cooler and used the side pockets to transport everything else. 

I love the handles on the straps, the color combo is perfection, and the space is top notch!

This will be a lifesaver on camping and beach trips!
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag came at a time I needed it most. It is portable because you can collapse it and also has room for expansion. Great for picnics and family outings. Well made and the color scheme is lovely.
review.name: Portable yet roomy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I think this is going to be such a game changer for doing sports for my girls this year. I love how you can expand the side pockets but then fold them right back up - super easily - if they aren’t needed. Lots of pockets and I loved the pop of color inside. So nice to have the shoulder straps as well. This is so lightweight with nothing in it. We have a yeti backpack that is so heavy when it’s empty I can’t carry it once it’s full!
review.name: Spring Sports Ready!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Speaking from the perspective of a mom, this cooler is one of the handiest options I’ve found on the market. The space is customizable — meaning you can keep the side compartments tucked/collapsed and buttoned out of the way or you can open one or both for extra “dry” storage. The middle/inner compartment is the cooler section, with a gorgeous peachy pink hued waterproof liner. The zipper pulls on the outside are the same pretty color with gold hardware. So not only does it boast lots of storage space and usability, it is also fashionable! 

Front zip compartment with pocket inside. Two slim zip bags on each side. Back has a nice sleeve that would fit over a suitcase handle for traveling. 

For the ball games or family outings, whether you’re on top of a mountain or hanging out at the beach, this cooler has a 24-can capacity to give you insight on the amount of space. It’s going to hold plenty.

I also find this cooler perfect for the back of the car — keeps small things wrangled, and a space to keep drinks, snacks, or groceries cold on the go. The bag also has a “treated” liner, with antibacterial protection that helps avoid odor causing bacteria. Obviously, clean after every use to avoid that problem anyways! The cooler compartment Velcro’s shut, rather than zip. It seems to close tight, but I would’ve liked the extra zip feature. 

It’s a nice product! I can’t wait to beach with it this summer.
review.name: Awesome Cooler!

name: Now 24-Can Tote Cooler

description: Buy the Danner Crater Rim GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Crater Rim GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Danner Crater Rim GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Crater Rim GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Outstanding boot - comfortable, supportive, protective & good looking.
review.name: 2nd pair in 3 years!

review.itemreviewed: Crater Rim GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I realize that these boots are made for "backpacking" and not peaking mountains and doing trail work but that's what I bought them for. The boots held up great in the beginning but 3 months in and the boots are essentially falling apart via the stitching in the sides of the boot which is a bit disappointing considering the cost, although to be fair they've been through a lot. I love the boots but have purchased new ones and have essentially retired them. I personally think they look great and they are very comfortable and needed zero break in for me.
review.name: A fine boot

review.itemreviewed: Crater Rim GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love these.  The day they fail and need retiring, which is probably like a decade away, I'm buying another pair.  They break in fast (all things considered), they're comfortable, they're extremely capable.  I've worn them just to wear them and I've worn them when I absolutely needed them.  They've yet to let me down and I've come to trust these as much as any other piece of gear.  I think they're good looking, though my wife emphatically disagrees.

I know that a lot of people feel some manner of ill will towards Danner for not being the same company they were in the 80's or whatever.  I've heard people argue against them for being all hype, or not as technically advanced as their competitors, or some of the manufacturing going overseas, or whatever whatever whatever.  

Danner is still in the business of making bombproof boots.  This is one of them.
review.name: The Business.

review.itemreviewed: Crater Rim GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very well built. Only put 30 miles on them and they seem to be breaking in ... only problem with this boot is I wear 10.5 but the boot is more of 11 size feel. Left a lot of unwanted room. I bought inserts to help fill the void. Hills. Rocks. Mud. These boots can tough all of it.
review.name: Good boot

review.itemreviewed: Crater Rim GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I?m a 53 year old retired Army Green Beret.  Been all over the world, wore almost every brand of major high end boot while in SF.  I?m also a hard-core backcountry bowhunter and have hunted Alaska, all across Canada, all over the Rockies....etc.  I am a HUGH fan of the Danner Crater Rim boot.  I have 3 pair of them and have several hundred miles on each pair without a single issue.  Invest in a quality pair of Gaiters and head the F-out without worrying about your boots!!
review.name: Danner Crater Rim

name: Crater Rim GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: 2FO Roost Flat Canvas Mountain Bike Shoe
review.reviewBody: Have been a FiveTen user for years, but these shoes have them beat. Similar to a Freerider, but more supportive, and better grip. Been hammering on these for over a year now, (3-4 rides a week) and they show little to no signs of crazy wear. Going to order up a few pairs so I'm set for a long time.
review.name: Oh baby!

review.itemreviewed: 2FO Roost Flat Canvas Mountain Bike Shoe
review.reviewBody: Did not want to write a review until I wore these shoes on several rides.  These are exactly the flat pedal shoes that I needed. I normally take a size 45, and ordered a size 46.  Very comfortable.  Let's talk about grippiness.  WOW !  These shoes really stick to the pins on my flat pedals.  Almost like being clipped in.  Finally, they just look great.  Great shoes at a great price.
review.name: 2FO - A Great Flat Pedal Shoe

review.itemreviewed: 2FO Roost Flat Canvas Mountain Bike Shoe
review.reviewBody: Had to send them back
review.name: Ran at least a full size small

name: 2FO Roost Flat Canvas Mountain Bike Shoe

hasVariant.description: Buy the Adventure Medical Kits Molle Bag Tactical Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Good value and reasonable shipping time
review.name: Good kit at a reasonable price. Good delivery tim.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a wonderful kit to have on hand. Especially while camping or hiking. It’d be great to just keep in the car or house too. It’s compact size is perfect for traveling and doesn’t take up much space. It’s packed filled with almost everything you could need in an emergency including a 2' QuikClot dressing that quickly stops life threatening bleeding and a variety of other supplies for issues ranging from sprains to bug bites. Having this with us eases my mind and helps me be prepared for whatever. I think everyone should own one.
review.name: Ready for anything

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is kit is great to have on hand in case of an emergency. It’s a compact kit that makes it easy to carry around while hiking or mountain biking. I also keep one at my home and in my vehicles.  The QuikClot dressing can stop life-threatening bleeding. That is super important in an emergency situation. I highly recommend this product.
review.name: Must Have!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Molle first aid kit is a great addition for of vehicle. I like how everything is organized and easy to get to. It also comes with a variety of things I wouldn't think about having. This is perfect for on the go care weather that bethe vehicle, camping or hiking.
review.name: Great addition

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This trauma kit had everything you need in case of a small emergency. Its small and compact so it is convenient to take along anywhere. The bag itself is nice and sturdy. Includes multiple size bandages and gauze. Great addition to a home disaster kit.
review.name: Must have!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] With everything going on these days, keeping things on deck is a must. Love kits and especially because it is dark and keeps looking good. As a large family it is nice to know and be able to find what you have on hand. Very convenient.
review.name: Very Handy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This kit has a everything you need for a medical emergency. It’s very comprehensive and it all fits in a compact convenient kit. I keep one in my car and one in my house for those unexpected emergencies.
review.name: Great kit!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was super excited to get this Molle Bag Trauma Kit because we do a lot of camping, four wheeling, and traveling in our motorhome. It’s nice to have when out on the road because things do happen. It’s a good quality kit with some great supplies to have on hand in the event of an emergency. We actually went camping and had an emergency with one of our children. Our youngest child got hurt and we grabbed her up and put her in our motorhome. I went straight to where I kept this kit and grabbed the ace bandage and the ice pack because we believed she had a broken arm. The ice pack did not work. It wasn’t the end of the world and we were able to get some ice in a bag so it worked out fine. Things like that do happen. We were able to splint her arm using things we had already and a lot of things we used from the kit and the kit was a great thing to have on hand. The scissors helped tremendously with cutting off her shirt and cutting bandages. I’ve never had a first aid kit that came with these medical scissors or the stop bleed. All in all this is a fantastic first aid kit to have. I was extremely pleased with it.
review.name: Great to have!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Been meaning to get a first aid kit for awhile most are either too bulky or lacking items but this one fit the bill perfectly. This easily fits inside a backpack for hunting or hiking, is easy to store in a vehicle or while out riding on the utv. It comes with about the normal items of a well stocked first aid kit plus a field guide book which is a nice touch plus a quick clot patch for serious wounds if need be. Overall I’m super pleased with this kit hoping I never have to use it though!
review.name: Just what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great set for the person on the go or outdoors person. Perfect in the event of an emergency too. Small compact doesn’t weigh much and can easily be tossed in a purse or backpack or in the car. I’d recommend for anyone.
review.name: Nice bag

name: Molle Bag Tactical Kit

review.reviewBody: I'm a 32 waist,  purchased a size medium and they are  about 1-2" too large around my waist. Great material and very light. I'm going to return and afraid to order a small.
review.name: Way to big in the waist

review.reviewBody:
I've had these for a few months now and have used them snowshoeing, snow camping, backpacking, and walking the dog in the PNW. I think the Stretch Ozonic pant offers a good balance of weight, durability, and breathability. No, they're not as bomber as my GORE-TEX Pro pants, but they're more flexible, pack smaller, and don't weigh as much. 

I love the ability to vent the legs via side zips and the little pocket is a perfect size for a phone, trash, or other misc. items on the trail. 

On a recent section of the PCT it rained pretty solid for 2 days and these performed as well as hoped. If you've ever hiked in rain pants you know you'll eventually get damp from the outside or the inside...so maintain realistic expectations. I hiked comfortably in the rain all day by adjusting the vents based on weather and general material breathability...I can't say that for many other rain pants I've owned in the past.
review.name: Field Tested

review.reviewBody: I worm my about 20 times in warm and cold weather.  They have kept me dry and done really well at blocking the wind.  I like to wear something else underneath the pants otherwise it feels a little clammy.  Mine have little tabs at the bottom that I use with an elastic cord to keep them down, but I only need that on the very windiest days or went post holing through snow.   I have a short inseam and they fit great.
review.name: Comfortably Stretchy

review.reviewBody: Great match for the ozonic jacket. These pants are stretchy and very mobile for staying active in the rain. I tend to wear tights or shorts underneath. Nice and breathable. Will keep you dry during your activities!
review.name: Perfect lower layer for staying dry while active

review.reviewBody: I wanted an uninsulated hard shell pants for all 4 seasons to block rain and some wind. I used these pants with an insulated polartec pant and cold weather baselayer to climb in -20 F and they did their job perfectly.
review.name: Versatile hard shell

review.reviewBody: These pants are great! They are very light and soft but they have proven to be very durable too. I usually wear them foraging in wet PNW forests scrambling around through brush and thorns and they have held up well without any trouble. I have also worn them backpacking and cross country skiing. They work great over a base layer or over regular pants, they are so soft and stretchy that it doesn’t feel like wearing too many layers even over double knee work pants. They pack into their own pocket so they are easy to bring along just in case it gets wet outside. I usually wear large but I chose a medium in these pants and I’m glad.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Quality fit and pants are all what I expected. Worth the $
review.name: 5 Star Rating

review.reviewBody:
This raingear is breathable, lightweight, and comfortable. its very packable, it easily rolls up and doesn't take up much space in a backpack or on my boat. I haven't gotten the chance to really test out the waterproof capabilities in heavy rain yet but based on the material and my experience with other raingear it looks like it will be pretty effective.
I like the full zipper legs on these pants. they make taking them off and putting them on easy with shoes on.
review.name: Lightweight

review.reviewBody: I love the way these pants look and fit.  Haven't had a chance to test the waterproof capability yet, but from the construction I have no doubt they will be excellent.  Love the attached belt as well.
review.name: Very pleased

review.reviewBody: Over midweight pants the fit was so so, a little more room would have been better. Winter weight pants would be an issue. Waterproofness seems good but hard to say since I have only worn them while walking/hiking haven't sat in them for long in the rain like in a hunting situation. The Velcro tabs however were a total fail. They weren't study enough to hold under the slightest pressure at the hip even though the waist has elastic across the back. Added heavier Velcro with some Gorilla glue. Seam sealed thigh pocket and fly are definite pluses. Full length side leg zips were a must for easy on and off but the design needs work they don't totally detach because of zipper pulls at both ends
review.name: Excellent stretch & good breathability

name: Stretch Ozonic Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, strong and just the right size! Also appreciate the reflective loops on them!
review.name: Great Stakes!

review.reviewBody: Liked these until they got taken by airport security
review.name: Won't get through tsa

review.reviewBody: This V-Stake is an additional accessory for camping. We used it with the Stormbreak 2 tent. It's sturdier than the stakes that came with the tent when we bought it.
review.name: Good tent stake

review.reviewBody: Used this for replacement stakes that had bent or gotten lost.
review.name: Great stakes!

review.reviewBody: Very strong and sturdy. This will be a good replacement for my others that bent too easily.
review.name: Very strong

review.reviewBody: These work great in soft or firm soil! Do not be fooled by the lightweight aluminum feel, they are amazingly strong. Make sure you install them at an angle with the top away from your tent, secure your guy line and tension it down! I have used these in super soft soil, clay, sandy, and rocky soil, they will work for most scenarios. Don't beat on them too much with large rocks or they will bend, but I think any stakes would.
review.name: Great Value For a Needed Item!

review.reviewBody: Great tent stakes with a nice holding power in soft or firm soil. Of course if you beat them with a large rock they will bend, but not without significant effort. I would choose these stakes along many other premium versions.
review.name: Great Value For a Needed Item!

review.reviewBody: Tent stakes. What can you say better than what came with tent. Solid. But tent stakes.
review.name: Caught on sale good deal

review.reviewBody: Perfect for my next camping adventure! Going to pair it with my trail lite 3 tent.
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great stakes, super sturdy and seem to be of good quality
review.name: Would recommend

description: Buy the Specialized Roubaix Pro Clincher Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Roubaix Pro Clincher Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Roubaix Pro Clincher Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair of the 30/32 Roubaix 2bliss for my gravel bike and liked them so much I purchased the 23/25 clincher for my road bike to replace the Continental 4 seasons. I find that they roll faster, and recently rode a long section on dirt road and crushed stone-the grip was outstanding, especially considering I had them at 95 PSI as the off road was a surprise! The design is super as the smooth center section rolls smooth and fast, and the outer section works well when needed. I don?t feel that they ride harsh as other riders noted, but I use them on HED Ardennes + rims so that may be the difference. I feel they are a great value and design!
review.name: Roubaix Pro Clincher Tire 23/25

review.reviewBody: I bought these just to see how they would handle the patches of rough caliche i have to traverse at times. They wear like tank treads. The theory is plausible, tread on the edges, smooth for speed in the middle. Thing is, they are HARD.  Put them on rode some of our rough roads here (not even the caliche) and developed a headset/steering tube vibration. Thought the compression plug was bad as did LBS. Changed it. Still vibrated. It finally (duh) dawned on me that the tires perhaps were harder than i thought. Switched back to Conti 5000 just on the front and magically the vibration disappeared.  Faster, less vibration, still good flat control. Experiment over. Staying with Conti 5000.
review.name: A tank but a very, very hard tank

name: Roubaix Pro Clincher Tire

review.reviewBody: They are affordable and reliable.
review.name: They work as intended.

review.reviewBody: These cleats would be perfect for first time clipless riders, also great for people like me who have had a few falls and gave clip in pedals because of fear of getting hurt. I installed the new cleats on my shoes and started riding with my Simano XT pedals again, after a few practice rides my conference returned, they are so easy to un clip it makes you think they might release when you don?t want them to but that?s not the case. I now have about 10 rides on the new cleats and not one prerelease and more importantly not one fall, even if to totally panic and try to get your foot down without a twisting motion, they will release, I?m done with flats for good!
review.name: Easy Release

Working on installing it in basement of class A
