review.reviewBody: Fridge works pretty good. But if you purchase it based on smart features like bluetooth or wifi you will be disappointed and there is no direct support available.
review.name: overall good
comment:
Dear Customer,
Thank you for reaching out. If you need any support, our customer service will be happy to help you. Contact us via our support form, which is available from the webshop.

Kind Regards,
Dometic Sales Support

review.reviewBody: Love it!  I have it running nearly all the time. Either out at camp or in my garage. I like the ability to have frozen ice cream on a hot weekend camping. It’s easy to set the temperature. Totally recommend it.
review.name: Pricy but we’ll worth it

review.reviewBody: Finally took this out on an extended road trip to truly test out. Had the fridge temp set on 40 degrees which didn’t seem to keep to stuff at the top near the lid that cool, so turned down to 38 and within 2 hours my reign energy drinks and summer shandys that were at the bottom exploded/cracked from being too cold and leaked everywhere. I don’t think I had it overstocked, had cans at the bottom and a few pre packaged salads set on top. Guessing the temperature inconsistency is just a design issue? I will still take it considering it makes a good bench to sit on in the van. Draws low power in fridge mode however does drain my battery about 50 percent faster when one side is set to freezer mode. I do wish the right side was the same size as the other as I feel like it’s a waste of storage space having the l shape inside. Now I wish I had a seperate freezer altogether due to lack of space.
review.name: Exploding beer and energy drink cans
comment:
Dear Customer, 

If you experience any hindrance in the performance of the cooler, please contact our support team through the ticket system here:
https://www.dometic.com/en-us/support/product-support-form#contact-us

(Please do not sit on the coolbox, as it can damage it.)

Kind regards, 
Dometic

review.reviewBody: I bought this for the boat and it exceeded my expectations. It maintained the temperature are needed and used considerably less electricity than the previous refrigerator.
review.name: Works perfect

review.reviewBody: We got the dual zone 75 L unit for our 4WD van. Have used it for over a year now and it's truly been a game changer for us. We use the van to travel in remote parts of northern BC, Yukon and Alaska. We have driven hundreds (thousands?) of miles on dirt roads and 4WD rough roads. The fridge has worked well despite being put through severe vibration, heat, and cold. It draws on average around 20-25 Ah off our battery overnight (12+ hours), and our 400W solar panels plus some engine charging on dark cloudy days has easily recharged the battery the next day plus provide power for the day's operation. We operate one compartment as a freezer and one as a fridge. We're always amazed at how much we can fit in there, and how everything stays cold even when the compartment is overstuffed. I have no idea whether other brands are better or worse, but I can vouch for our unit having exceeded our expectations. The unit is expensive compared to a home fridge, but so far it's been great for our van setup and needs.
review.name: 1+ year later and very happy

review.reviewBody: i bought the dometic cfx3 75dz cause a friend has a older one. i used mine the past 3 months with a solar charger and love it.
review.name: great cooler

review.reviewBody: Bought this a few weeks ago for car camping - not the smallest or lightest piece of kit but the volume and separate freezer capability tipped the choice. Fully laden with food and drink and it will likely require two people to lift in and out.  I have a Goal Zero YETI 500X and a Nomad 100 Solar Panel - with the unit set at -10C for freezer and 4C for fridge it’s drawing ~35W on the 12V outlet which means the solar panel easily keeps the YETI fully recharged during day, even if we’re using the YETI for recharging mobile devices, laptops or powering camp lights.  Runs very quiet, can hardly hear it. Very pleased with purchase.
review.name: Efficient, Quiet & Great For Car Camping
comment:
Hi David,

We are so happy to hear that you've gotten a lot of use out of the CFX3 75DZ fridge and that you've enjoyed the dual-zone fridge/freezer functionality. 

Thank you so much for this review! 

Dometic

review.reviewBody: Such a disappointment. Lasted 2 years of use before electrical failure on both AC and DC power supplies. Great concept with poor execution of engineering.
review.name: Stops working in 2 years.
comment: i have a question for you. you say it lasted you 2 years the ? is how was you using it did you leave it in the sun or was it covered see the reason im asking is im building me a camper for my motorcycle and im looking to get something like this but i plan to have it built in and never removed always covered and this is the first look into one of these and just trying to ask the right ?'s before i buy one or one like it im planing to travel the country and dont need something that is going to fail try to keep cost as low as i can

name: CFX3 75 Dual Zone Powered Cooler

review.reviewBody: So much better than the CamelBak metal bottles. These ones are not heavy and they balance well in your hand. The water flow is controlled, but more than adequate.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: I used two of these bottles on my ride of the Great Divide Mountain Bike Route from Canada to Mexico this past summer. The flow was great and I enjoyed having no plastic taste in my water. The blue finish held up great and they still look almost like new. Should get many years of use from these bottles. Thanks Bivo!
review.name: Worked great with no plastic flavor

review.reviewBody:
Be careful with this bottle. My first swig, I almost drowned as I was expecting flow similar to my traditional bottles! I was honestly skeptical of the claim that it let water out faster than I could squeeze it from a regular bottle. It totally does. I can’t imagine needing to drink faster than this allows. The valve is easy to open and secure rely close too, so it does work well on the bike. So far the rubberized finish has held up really well. It also pulls apart easily for washing. I’m not sure yet that it’s replaced my other bottles, but it’s definitely in the rotation especially if I just want a bottle to carry around during the day.
It is a bit heavier than my plastic bottles, and sometimes I like being able to shoot water out if either me or the bottle is too dirty on mountain bike rides. This only pours out, but it pours REALLY well!
review.name: Exceeded my expectations!

review.reviewBody: The flow is great. Does it keep water colder longer? NO. It seems like water gets warmer, faster than a good insulated bottle. Is it worth it, No.
review.name: Is it worth it?

review.reviewBody:
I was very surprised by how fast the water flowed from this solid water bottle. This bottle is a great alternative to plastic squeeze bottles, and the water seriously rushes out at the slightest tip of the bottle. 

One note to watch out for: These bottles seem taller than normal plastic bottles and it was a very close fit for the geometry of my mountain bike. It's good to check the sizing if you have limited space on the frame due to the rear suspension on your bike.
review.name: Almost Too Much Water

review.reviewBody: It works flawlessly and not having to squeeze is a great feature. It pours like a cup but since it's a bottle with a nozzle it doesn't spill all over. It also feels solid since it's stainless steel and I like not contributing to more plastic. I haven't had any issues with it leaking after taking the initial sip and until then I just level the spout closed. I do like the coated stainless steel for added grip and so far haven't had any issues with it getting scratched via the bottle cage.
review.name: Quality!

review.reviewBody: I just got this bottle and love it. I was skeptical of the stainless steel, but it is awesome. It is super durable and easy to sip from. The high-flow nozzle is amazing and the flow is perfect. Not too much and not too little.
review.name: Love it!

name: Duo 25oz Non-Insulated Bottle

hasVariant.name: Summit Evo Ice Axe
hasVariant.description: Buy the Petzl Summit Evo Ice Axe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This was great and I really liked it! Lighter than I expected.  Unfortunately I fell into a crevasse/waterfall the first time out and lost it. But I’m alive so can’t be too mad about losing it! I’ll likely buy this same one again later in the year.
review.name: Loved it!

review.reviewBody:
I've only brought this axe out on 2 climbs in RMNP so far, but I really like it. I got rid of my Raven a couple years ago, and have been using a Sum'Tec on most of my climbs. But I've been missing something longer for lower angle stuff. The Sum'Tec is awesome, but it's short enough that it's only handy in really steep terrain. 
The Summit Evo is perfect on low angle approaches, and less technical climbs. I've used it on Ptarmigan Fingers and Dragon's Tail, and it's great. Plunges great, chops steps easily, the pick bites well into snow. I wouldn't take it on anything steep, like Dreamweaver, but that's not what it's meant for. The angled shaft makes it really comfortable walking in cane position. 
One of the best things (to me) is that it also accepts the Trig-Rest. It took some finagling to fit it right, but I drop it down low on the shaft when I'm chopping steps. Between the trig-rest and the grip on the shaft, I don't use a wrist-leash. Great axe!
review.name: Great Axe for General Mountaineering

name: Summit Evo Ice Axe

review.reviewBody:
I'm so glad I didn't skimp and get a cheap air mattress for car camping. This really is the gold standard of comfort. It inflates quickly, perfectly fits my '13 Tucson, and was comfortable for me and my 6'1" partner (and our pup). Like any camp bed, it doesn't pack down super small, but I think it's pretty compact and didn't take up a ton of room. Paired with the Luno window screens, you've got a car camping setup fit for a king or queen. 
Word to the wise: there are multiple valves on each side, so don't be a goofball like me and forget to close one and then wonder why the bed isn't staying inflated...
review.name: The 5-star hotel of air mattresses

name: 2.0 Air Mattress

description: Buy the Burley Tail Wagon online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tail Wagon
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Tail Wagon online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Y'all aren't gonna believe this, but I biked with my dog and boyfriend all the way from San Luis Obispo, California to San Francisco, California. 300 miles of pulling my dog in the tail wagon, trailer pullin living. 

This thing held up like a champ, we went on dirt roads, hills, roads with potholes, got on a train and bus, and pulled a bunch of other stuff too. My dog is only 11 pounds so we had room for gear as well in the tail wagon. I highly recommend this product although it is a little pricey, it was wonderful how easily it folded up and could be stowed away or carried onto public transportation. It was also nice how easily we could switch it between the two bicycles.

Thank you, Burley for this product. If you ever need an influencer or pictures to show off your tail wagon trailer, let me know. I take it on mini really cool adventures. Lol
review.name: Trailer Travelers.

review.reviewBody: great purchase / easy to set-up on both bikes (Race bike and Hybrid)
review.name: great pruchase

review.reviewBody: I bought the Tail Wagon for our pup who is a Cardigan Welsh Corgi. She is just 4 months old now so we take short frequent trips to get her accustomed to riding. We did put the off road 16” tires on the wagon plus we added the bed Burley sells which adds a lot of comfort. If your dog is taller, it does take up a good bit of room so be sure to measure to make sure your dog and the bed will fit comfortably. I can tell my pup is going to love it as she jumps right in for the ride!
review.name: Tail Wagon

review.reviewBody: I have the big wheels. Traveling all over USA. He likes it. Ez to setup.
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody: Quality trailer, Dog happy, fantastic upgrade, thank you Burley
review.name: Quality trailer, Dog happy, fantastic

review.reviewBody: I have a 16 year old shitzu Maltese mix. He has severe separation anxiety whenever I leave him alone. Up until the purchase of the tail wagon I was unable to get out riding my bike, it has allowed me to have some freedom. Thank you, love it don’t even notice it attached to my bike
review.name: Burley tail wagon is a lifesaver

review.reviewBody: It could be a little taller for my dog, but the trail wagon would have been too big.
review.name: Trail wagon

review.reviewBody:
We have had our Tail Wagon for a short period. It seems to be well constructed. Our dogs love going in it for short rides. We will be going on a long trip soon so that will be the true test. 
I only wish that it came with rain flaps to keep tge dogs dry on those we days.
review.name: Great to haul our 2 Boston Terriers

review.reviewBody: We use our Burley wagon so our dog can join us on long bicycle rides.
review.name: ACD Red Heeler Ruby loves her Burley

review.reviewBody: My puppy loves to travel in this chariot as we commute three miles to and from my work! I feel like she is safe, as the chariot is well-built and very stable behind my bike.
review.name: Perfect for the Pup

name: Tail Wagon

review.reviewBody: This is basically an $80 Big 5 athletic shirt. Nothing special about it. Not especially comfortable. No integrated goggle wipe. No high end Polartech materials like Fox.  Sizing is very large.  XL was too big for me and neck line was massive. I am always an XL. After inspection, I refuse to believe this is any more durable than run of the mill athletic apparel. I've noticed POC items are extremely overpriced, and that is in a sea of overpriced MTB apparel. This should be a budget jersey. Considering my experience with this jersey and the Tectal helmet, it is obvious that the amount of design and forethought that goes into POC's offerings is very minimal. I recommend looking at the Troy Lee Sprint or Sprint Ultra for a very hardy Downhill Jersey. The Raceface Ruxton is extremely comfortable, but perhaps a bit less durable than the Troy Lee Sprint line. Check out Fox Defend for cutting edge material. I get it, people like the simplicity of POC. But you can have a simplistic appearance while still keeping up with other companies technologically.
review.name: Might as well go to Big 5

name: Essential DH Long-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Optimus Terra Camp 4 HE online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used the pot set on multiple camping trips now and it has been a great upgrade. Main advantages are its size, especially when cooking food for 2 or more people and for making pasta. The straining lid is super useful and everything fits together nicely. Just remember to bring along your Honnold approved silicone spatula and you're set!
review.name: Great Camping Pot Set

review.reviewBody: I bought this cook set for my family of 4.  The pots and lids fit efficiently and compactly into the carrying case, and I like the insulated carrying case for making rice or pasta and setting it aside to cook while making the rest of the dinner on the burner.  The nonstick coating is nice and I had no issues with burning or sticking.  The heat trap on the bottom of the large pot is a cool idea, but could be a real challenge to clean if you boil over and get food bits stuck in there.  IT also makes it a bit of a challenge to get the pt safely onto the burner if you are using a minimalist stove like an MSR Pocket Rocket like I was.  Overall I'm really happy with the set.
review.name: Nice cookset for a group of 4

review.reviewBody: seems to be great quality and well thought out cooking gear

name: Terra Camp 4 HE

review.reviewBody: I loved the look of these, and have thought other Toad&Co items I got were high quality, but am disappointed in my purchase. They are very stretchy, and sort of bagged out after a few hours of wear. I ordered my usual size and wish I had sized down. I ordered both the brown and the black, and the brown pair lost a rivet the first time I wore them, and the second time I wore them I noticed loose threads coming out all along the outer leg seam. I wanted to exchange them in hopes that I just got a badly sewn pair, but not only would I have to pay to ship them back (which does not seem fair seeing as they are defective), but the size I need is sold out anyway. I'm pretty bummed to have spent so much money on some really low-quality pants.
review.name: Disappointed

name: Balsam Seeded Cutoff Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great hood to be warm.
My son is loving this hood so much. He's wearing every day to go to school.
The color is beautiful and the quality is amazing.
review.name: Great hood

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got the kids size not realizing they have adult sizes, but my head is kinda small so it still fits good. High quality fabric and such a pretty color! Haven’t been able to use it skiing yet since there’s no snow yet but I’m excited!
review.name: High quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s kind of a solid choice for cold-weather gear which is warmth, comfort, and coverage. It’s a great option for parent as me want to protect my kids during winter outdoor activities. However, I took off 1 start because it is kid size but little tight for my 2 year old. It should be better if having different sizes for me to pick. I also would recommend it will be earlier if it has open/close buttons or something from the back which is more convenient instead of pull on/off since kids don’t like.
review.name: Blackstrap !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Literally so prefect!!! Great for colder climates, and making you feel warm. It’s sturdy yet stretchy and comfortable to wear. It doesn’t make you feel suffocated or uncomfortable.
review.name: I highly recommend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Balaclava fits great and is easy to adjust to cover more/less head and face. The material also appears nice and to be well made. It seemed a bit loose until I washed it, then it fitted my face much better with just minimal shrinkage. It was very comfortable ,versatile.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very tight fit but very comfortable it has a lot of durability it is not versatile you can keep the nose part down it just comes back up but you can breathe though it so it is breathable material
review.name: Nice for winter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The kids’ expedition hood balaclava fit my child well. It was comfortable and breathable. The material was very soft but thick enough that it will last and be durable enough to wear year after year. The color was nice and will be able to be used with various coats/snow gear/outfits.
review.name: Fits nicely, breathable and keeps warm
comment: Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback! The Kids' Expedition Hood is a go to when the winter storms roll in. Glad to hear it is keeping your kid warm out there!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter loves this. She does think she's a ninja when she wears it but she said it keeps her face warm on her walk to school and during recess. She said all her friends like it and want one now so they can all be ninjas
review.name: Sizing

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Kids’ Expedition Hood Balaclava is a big hit with my son! He says it reminds him of a ninja mask, and I can see why—he looks like he’s ready for some serious action on the slopes! The fit is perfect, and it fully covers his face and neck, keeping him warm in the wind and snow.

What stands out is the quality. The lightweight TREO exterior does a great job at keeping the cold out, while the 360° PERFA mesh liner inside keeps him warm without overheating. He can run around, ski, or build snow forts for hours without feeling clammy. It’s breathable, so he doesn’t complain about it getting stuffy, and it’s clearly built for all-day comfort in the cold. If you’re looking for a reliable balaclava that kids will love wearing, this one’s worth it!
review.name: Perfect for Little Adventurers Who Want to Look Like Ninjas!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm really loving this BlackStrap Balaclava and am so happy to have this for the upcoming season. This works really well for staying warm during outdoor activities as well as full days outside in winter. The four-way stretch material used is comfortable and allows for a second-skin fit without compromising mobility. I like how there are so many options for vibrant colors and patterns for the whole family. The wind- and sun-protection this offers is amazing as well, especially for those who live over in the mountains like us! Item arrived in a timely manner.
review.name: Breathable Fabric + Excellent Warmth

name: Expedition Hood - Kids'

hasVariant.name: Linear GORE-TEX Mitten - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the 686 Linear GORE-TEX Mitten - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Kept my hands very warm. Large enough to wear glove liners with as well.
review.name: Great gloves.

review.reviewBody: Great mitt and a great price. Super warm for Alpine ski days and generous sizing. Seems durable and well made but have only had them up on the slopes a few times.
review.name: Great mitt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits great and GORE-TEX material is no joke. Completely water-proof and warm enough to keep you comfortable on the slopes. Was still able to use my hands a decent bit for basic functions but obviously if you want full functionality go with their gloves.
review.name: Mitts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great glove . Very warm. Kept hand warm and dry all day.
review.name: AWESOME Mitt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great glove just like everything else from 686. Very warm. Kept hand warm and dry all can ask for
review.name: Toasty

review.reviewBody: I’ve skied with gloves my whole life, but have been battling cold hands in recent years. Tested these mitts out this past week at June Mountain, temps were in the teens and 20s, they kept my hands very warm. Only reason I’m giving a 4 and not a 5 is because the quality was a little disappointing - the wrist strap on the right mitt completely separated the 1st day as I was putting them on - it was as if it had never been sewed on completely , maybe just tacked? I think I just had a “bad mitt”, my wife and son have the same pair and they had no problems. All around, very warm and very dry. It was rain/snow mix the last day of skiing and my hands were completely dry.
review.name: 686 Men’s GORE-TEX Linear Mitt

review.reviewBody: This will be a Christmas gift for my son. Quality appears to be good. Wrist strap is not wide one like shown on other gloves. I have a big hand and long fingers and this XL barely fits me. His fingers are longer, so we'll see. Can't judge fit by measurement scheme on website. Wrist elastic seems to be too far toward hand, doesn't feel right. Elastic cord closures don't seem to work well. May have to return. Love 686 products, but not sure about this one.
review.name: 686 Linear Mitt - Not sure

review.reviewBody: Love that they come with a wrist strap so you won't drop them off the lift when you take the gloves off to use your phone. Also, can't go wrong with a GORE-TEX mitt, hands warm, cozy, and most importantly, DRY.
review.name: Great gloves.

review.reviewBody: I went with a large when I'm in between Medium/Large. Glad I did. I have plenty of room for inserts if I want to go that route. These are my new favorite gloves.
review.name: best gloves ever.

review.reviewBody: These mittens are great! Really warm and easy to take on and off while helping my kids with their gear. I liked that the Goretex isn’t limited to a liner, like most gloves are. The only reservation I have about them is that the palm protective material could be a little thicker and pliable.
review.name: Legit!

name: Linear GORE-TEX Mitten - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall really happy with this pad, just what I was looking for. I have had a terrible pad for even and just wanted some comfort so I was willing to sacrifice room in my pack, cause this is on the larger end, but was worth it. The only thing is that the material it's made of seems to stain easily with sweat or dirt, keep this in mind if you plan on reselling it later. But I was able to wash most of it off in accordance with what sea to summit says about washing sleeping pads.
review.name: Very comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Relatively easy to use, comfortable, although not a noticable difference as far as deigned "for women". Largest concern was size for backpacking. even when it arrived it was larger than expected - and compared to my husbands self inflating pad its about 4 times larger.
review.name: Comfortable but bigger than expected for backpacking

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is QUIET, and much easier to inflate. Yes, it says self-inflating, but I found it required a couple breaths of air to inflate fully. Very warm when sleeping, and comfortable on the ground even though much thinner than my other inflatable sleep pad.
review.name: It's Quiet!

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like it was comfortable to sleep on It. However, it doesn't self-inflate completely. I have to give a few more breaths in to inflate it. Also, it doesn't deflate all the way. I had to roll out the air.
review.name: I like it was comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The very first night I used it, I woke up on the ground because there was a hole in it. However, the patch system is great and I used the patched up version for the following 10 nights without issue. Pretty comfy and a lifesaver after an intense hike.
review.name: Pretty good

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: Light, warm, and very comfortable. This is my new go to pad for light weight camping adventures
review.name: Light, warm, and very comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the most comfortable sleeping pad I've ever used. I have 8 different sleeping pads and this is the best for sleeping on my side and staying warm. My hips do not touch the ground through this because it's very supportive in the hip area especially designed for women. It was very easy and quick to inflate. I'll be using this as my main sleeping pad every time I go camping. I love it!
review.name: Best Sleep Pad Ever

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: I used this on the AT for 15 days! I've had 3 back surgies (L4 & L5) ... this sleeping pad was like sleeping on air ... perfection!
review.name: I used this on the

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m so glad I bought this sleeping pad! After using an ultra lightweight inflatable sleeping pad (from a different brand) that deflated and had to be patched multiple times, I decided to go for a pad which is the best of both worlds, and I have no regrets! This pad is easy to inflate, it’s super comfortable, and absolute worth the little extra weight. I’m a side sleeper and this pad keeps me comfy all night and doesn’t make noise when I roll over. 100% Recommend.
review.name: I’m so glad I bought

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light SI Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: I can’t believe how comfortable it is! I slept on rocks and hardly knew it. It did require some active inflation though it was easy to do. Packs up small easily after use, too.
review.name: Highly recommended

review.itemreviewed: Assegai Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: I ordered this tire, another tire, and a fork after ensuring they were in stock. Despite them all being in stock I was given a 5 day ship time. Then my order was split - the fork in one, the tires in a different, separate shipment. The fork made it as promised. The tires did not. Backcountry sent an email telling me the tires would be here the next day and to ‘wait by my mailbox’. The next day came and went - no tires. I called backcountry and was told they reached out to fedex and the tires would arrive Saturday morning by 7:30. I didn’t believe that at all and said as much. I was assured they would be there and to call if they weren’t here by noon. Noon came and went, no tires. Another phone call, more shipping lies from backcountry. Monday they said. No tires on Monday. Customer service was rude and condescending. Now they also started blaming fedex. I told them they could take their tires back and provide a refund. Still waiting on that to happen. I’ll not purchase from them again - worst customer service I’ve encountered in a very long time.
review.name: Terrible service
comment: I’m sorry to hear about the frustrating experience with your order and the communication issues regarding the tires. We’ve emailed you to help resolve this situation and ensure it’s addressed promptly.

review.itemreviewed: Assegai Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: Great tire lots of traction
review.name: Grippy tire

review.itemreviewed: Assegai Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: Great fast shipping. Got them in a few days. They charged my card the day it delivered. And overall the tires are awesome.
review.name: Great company and tires

review.itemreviewed: Assegai Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: Put in my trek fuel ex  the minion dhr II 2.4 and assegai 2,6, the best combination ever, backcountry the best service and products. thanks
review.name: The best tires

review.itemreviewed: Assegai Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody:
It is a very heavy tire but great for sharp and rocky rough stuff. It will really bite into a tight and sharp turn beyond belief. Super low PSI isn't as necessary for grip with this tire.  2.6" version on my front.

Wheelies.... forget it go XC tire for agility, or Rekon for a tweener tire. It's far more enduro and heavy trail use, or when conditions are loose and slippery.
review.name: Great front tire for turning hard

review.itemreviewed: Assegai Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: A good friend of mine convinced me to trynthese out and I absolutely love them.  I have  traditionally been a DHF/DHR guy but after trying these out on the front I am now a DHR/Assegai guy.  I feel like I now have a lot more confidence in my front tire on the trail.  Seriously give them a try.
review.name: My new favorite front tire

review.reviewBody: Incredible jacket for the money! Perfect fit, weight and warmth. Love the color too! Quality in every way
review.name: Beautiful jacket

review.reviewBody: Purchased Black sz Medium. Boxy unflattering fit, gigantic hood has more down than the front panels, heavy, not packable for bc skiing, some details like sleeve cuffs look cheap, OR logo only on the side of the arm so the front is very plain looking. Bought this to replace OR Transcendent Hoody from 2019. Disappointed with all the above and will be returning. Sadly, OR does not make any hoodies that are comparable to the Transcendent.
review.name: Boxy fit, bulky hood, heavy and not packable

review.reviewBody: This is sooo nice looking. Love the color and the fit. I how it works as well as it looks.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I would say this jacket is fantastic, but with a few really frustrating exceptions. Pros: the loft and warmth is great, it’s a touch more burly than most down jackets which is nice, the fit is fantastic-that magical sweet spot of being able to layer underneath comfortably without being tight in the arms (a rarity I seldom find these days), and the value at this price is great. The cons: very drafty around the cuffs, and the hood is so lofty and stuffed that it’s always pressing against the back of my head when I’m sitting in the car which drives me crazy. My wife has the women’s version which has both wrist gaiters to keep out drafts and a much better hood-if those issues could be addressed this would be one of my all time favorites
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Quality jacket providing good warmth on cold ventures.
review.name: Warmth

review.reviewBody: The jacket is so warm and fits really well. Usually down jackets aren't the best looking jackets if for >600 fills but OR have managed to put together a warm yet stylish jacket that finds a place on a hike or an office day alike.
review.name: Warm and stylish

review.reviewBody: The jacket is a perfect choice for the colder days. I love the design, comfort, and weight of it.
review.name: Perfect for the Cold

review.reviewBody: Slightly baggy fit but makes it easy to move around in and layer under, don't size down as it's designed to be baggy. Not designed to be water resistant and hard to fit a shell over so be aware of that. Hood sinches around the ears which is weird but it still decreases volume in the hood, just doesn't allow you to make a seal against drafts. Still a five star jacket.
review.name: great jacket, slightly baggy

review.reviewBody: Extremely lightweight and warm jacket. Fits me as it should. My new favorite...
review.name: Lightweight and warm...

review.reviewBody: For the price, this jacket is stellar. But I did expect it to be warmer. Anything below 35ºF with wind chill is a little colder than I'd like unless you're layering underneath. It looks puffier in the photos than it actually is. But generally a great buy - 8.52/10 Pros: Price, style (good pocket and hood design) Cons: could be a little warmer
review.name: Very good, not as warm as expected.

review.reviewBody: Only will tolerate ground soft enough to place with hands - tops are too brittle to use a rock.
review.name: Not worth the weight savings

review.reviewBody: Crazy light and tough as nails. The Carbon Core Tent Streaks match well with the MSR Front Range and the 100wing tarp. If yer looking to lighten your kit, consider upgrading your shelter steaks.
review.name: Lighten the load with these upgrades

review.reviewBody: Expensive but worth the extra cost in weight savings (minimal) but mostly in design. The spikes hold better than all other spikes I've used.
review.name: Worth The Cost

review.reviewBody: I've used these over the past year and a half, completing the Pacific Crest Trail (2650 miles) and Colorado Trail (473 miles) with no issues. They have been more durable that I expected. I usually push them into ground with my palm but there have been a few occasions where the ground was hard and I've beat them in with a rock. These stakes are decently durable and have held up to rock poundings. They have pretty good holding power for their size and weight.
review.name: 3000 miles and still going

review.reviewBody: These are lightweight yet strong. Their best feature is that you can push them into the ground with your boot, rather than mangling your fingers trying to push those skinny stakes most tent manufacturers provide! Love 'em!
review.name: Great upgrade from standard stakes!

review.reviewBody: I have both sizes. Love them. Use care when hammering. Better yet push in with palm. I carry one spare Mini Ground Hog
review.name: Sweet

review.reviewBody: I guess these are great for dirt, but we tried our brand new stakes out at Boyds Campground in Key West, and broke 2.     A seasoned camper there said we needed steel for the conditions in the Keys.  So...it is what it is.
review.name: We broke 2 in the Keys

review.reviewBody: They're lightweight and I'm sure work fine in soft soil. If your in the woods and there's rocks or roots they break
review.name: Not for my application

review.reviewBody: I upgraded the stakes that came with my hammocks to these MSR Carbon Core stakes. Saved a few ounces and I like the design. I use them to anchor my rain fly around trees where the soil is usually loose and soft. I would not use them in very hard gravel or packed down camp sites as I wouldn't want to break one given the price. Excellent for my application.
review.name: Great for softer soil and saves a few ounces!

review.reviewBody: Love these stakes! I generally keep 6-8 of these with me on most backpacks where I expect to camp on soft dirt or grass. They're as light as feathers... I would suggest grabbing the Groundhogs if you're expecting use on harder ground.
review.name: light as a feather

name: Carbon Core Tent Stakes

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Reservoir Running Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody:
I wanted to like this bag. It looks nice, has plenty of pocket space, and I like the drawstring straps across the chest. That's where the positives end. 

Onto the bad stuff. Sweat easily passes through the back of the bag; anything stored back there will be damp if not soaked by the end of your activity. The straw length is either too short or too long. It's impossible to route the straw from the bladder to the shoulder straps in a way that still makes the mouthpiece easily accessible. Having elastic loops instead of a clip to hold the straw seems like a major design flaw that was overlooked.
review.name: Much to be desired
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Reservoir Running Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: I love the way this vest fits and the way that it holds the reservoir snug. I don't feel the pack while I am trail running. The only problem that I have is the seam in the front is tearing after 10 - 12 uses. For the price, I would have hoped for better durability. Other than that, great vest.
review.name: Great Hydration Vest

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Reservoir Running Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: practical and easy to use, its comfortable during use even when its packed up
review.name: first vest

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Reservoir Running Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: I love this vest for hiking, trail running, walking, etc. I found I was able fit my 2.5 liter bladder in this vest without issue. I am normally a size small on top, have a 34" bust, and I got a size small which fits very well.
review.name: Great for everything!

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Reservoir Running Hydration Vest
review.reviewBody: This is a great vest and holds the weight of 2.5 liters of water so well you almost don’t notice it. However, the main compartment, where you keep all your valuables, is made of a non-porous material, and accumulates all of your sweat during a run or a hike. After my first outing, there was so much moisture in the main compartment that I was convinced my hydration reservoir sprung a leak. Nope, just bad material choice. I’m lucky my key-fob still worked afterwards. Such a bummer since the back and arm straps are so breathable. Not sure how this got overlooked before being mass produced and sold.
review.name: Fatally Flawed
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

name: Active Skin 12L Reservoir Running Hydration Vest

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mad Rock Redline Strap Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Really nice shoe at a great price. Take into account that Mad Rocks are 1 US Size smaller than a Scarpa Origin. Checked this for a Lotus and Redline. 1 US Size is the size of a dime, that's a big difference if your Scarpas fit nicely!
review.name: Really nice, runs small

review.reviewBody:
I only started wearing this shoe once my old shoes were discontinued, but I’ve actually found that I like these better. I have a pretty narrow heel, and I’ve tried a lot of different shoes and these have fit the best. The rubber is super sticky and lasts for a good while. They’re great in the gym and outside on reel rock. I will say these run a little small. I’m about two sizes smaller in these than my other madrock shoes. 
Also these shoes are written in the same font as Taylor Swift’s album Red so these are clearly the best shoes on the market.
review.name: Already Loving Red Lines

review.reviewBody: I've mostly climbed in the Madrock Drones but I'm happy that I chose to try the Redlines this time around. While the Drone is great for steep terrain and edging hard due to its stiffer rubber, these Redlines seem to me to be the perfect combo of a stiff chassis with softer rubber for sensitivity/stickiness. They fit really similarly to the drone if not a slight bit narrower than the HV drone. Was able to break these in fairly quick and look forward to using them for the rest of the season.
review.name: The perfect combo

review.reviewBody:
Hands down, the Redlines are the best aggressive shoe if you desire more feedback out of your steep rock shoes.

One of the many things I like more about these shoes compared to the Solutions is the amazing sensitivity and flexibility and mid-foot spring tension you get out of the Redlines. The Solutions always felt too stiff and bulky, but the Redlines give you super connected feedback on your foot placements. It really feels like my toes are grabbing the rock features. The ability to sense what my toes have been doing really leveled up my footwork on steep technical problems. The toebox is generously covered in rubber, and I?m so glad they kept the same heel of the Drones on the Redlines. Please never get rid of these heels! They are the best heels ever...

I wear size 9 M in street shoes and also size my Redlines in Size 9 for an out of the box snug fit. The vacuum fit on these are so satisfying. I love hearing that suction sound as you pull the shoes on.

These shoes have become my go-to steep climbing shoe, but also its one of my favorite shoes to train in. The feedback that I get in my toes/footwork translates immensely to outdoor climbs.
review.name: Shoes that make your footwork better

review.reviewBody: A soft shoe that is at home at any angle. Soft enough to dig in on steep terrain, or smear on slabs and stiff enough to stand on the smallest of edges. I wear a 8.5 street shoes and an 8 in the Redlines fit perfectly.
review.name: Performance shoe for any angle.

name: Redline Strap Climbing Shoe
